baresoilFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
baresoilFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

burntFractionAll.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
burntFractionAll.long_name: Percentage of Entire Grid Cell That Is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)
burntFractionAll.comment: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic Land-use change

cVeg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cVeg.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

fFire.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fFire.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
fFire.comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

lai.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
lai.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

mrsos.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
mrsos.comment: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the  soil layer.

npp.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
npp.long_name: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
npp.comment: 'Production of carbon' means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ('producers'), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. 'Productivity' means production per unit area. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

tran.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tran.comment: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).
